content.description:
Climb easy trad up the broken crack system leading to the left side of the large roof. Traverse right to the first bolt and climb straight out the near-horizontal roof.

 I invested over 50 attempts for the send on this beautiful line, which feels about as hard as my method on Cartography (Long Branch of Smoke Hole, WV), but is probably less my "style". I'm proposing 5.13d, thoughÂ grades don't make any sense. V9? to V5/6?

 This is a fantastic climb in a very special and isolated place. Finishing this route was a total dream. I hope you learn from and enjoy whatever experience you may have with this piece of stone.

 And if you send... best victory whip ever... the tree branches won't hurt you! Thanks, Jenny!
content.protection: 3 bolts + a little bit of gear to 2". 2-bolt anchor.

content.description:
West facing; often quite windy for the area. 

  Remember to keep your activity as low impact as possible: this area has been sensitive in the past, but it seems that Hidden has been awaiting some new activity for some time, as long as it is all conducted in a respectful, conscious manner.
